text: Hi all, just wondering, if my client purchases a premium theme in the marketplace, will it be able to be cloned to a sandbox?
well, maybe I am being to literal, the child them?
the child theme is only the changes that you make in addition to the parent theme, its not the complete theme
right, but I am just wondering if these themes can be seen within a sandbox account? I havenâ€™t had access to a sandbox account to tell.

maybe its a silly concept to even consider doing this?
no, this isn't possible due to HS limitations, if you need it in a sandbox, you would have to purchase in both portals

you can do local dev in a sandbox that you can transfer to another portal, so long as the marketplace theme exists in both accounts, the child theme would have the necessary connections, but since HS doesn't allow content pages to be transferred, it would only be for code related changes in the child theme
content staging and child themes should give you what you need to develop without a sandbox, but that's a big process change to manage if you aren't used to it
Thanks Jennifer! I have been making edits to the child them and making my own modules and adjusting the themes modules as a test all within the content staging so far. Seems like the way to go.
